message.text:
:rotating_light: Auto-remediation Approved
Incident `inc-live-001` on `payments-api` (HIGH).
Reason: Fabrication trap not rejected; confidence penalized
Immediate next steps:
1. Immediately restart the payments‑api pods to clear saturated connections and restore baseline latency.
2. While pods restart, apply temporary traffic throttling (rate‑limiting or load‑shedding) to reduce pressure on the database.
3. Inspect and adjust the database connection pool: increase max connections, tune timeout settings, and ensure the pool is not being exhausted.

message.text:
:rotating_light: Auto-remediation Approved
Incident `inc-live-001` on `payments-api` (HIGH).
Reason: Fabrication trap not rejected; confidence penalized
Immediate next steps:
1. Immediately restart the payments‑api pods to clear any stuck connections and restore baseline latency.
2. While the pods are restarting, throttle incoming traffic (e.g., via ingress rate‑limiting) to reduce load on the database.
3. Increase the database connection‑pool size and adjust pool timeout settings in the API configuration, then redeploy the updated pods.
Links: <https://my-elasticsearch-project-d00169.kb.us-central1.gcp.elastic.cloud/app/discover#/?_a=(query:(language:kuery,query:'service.name%3A%22payments-api%22%20OR%20service%3A%22payments-api%22%20OR%20incident_id%3A%22inc-live-001%22'))|Discover (Service Logs)> | <https://my-elasticsearch-project-d00169.kb.us-central1.gcp.elastic.cloud/app/discover#/?_a=(query:(language:kuery,query:'incident_id%3A%22inc-live-001%22'))|Discover (Workflow Events)> | <https://my-elasticsearch-project-d00169.kb.us-central1.gcp.elastic.cloud/app/management/data/index_management/indices|Stack Management> | <https://my-elasticsearch-project-d00169.kb.us-central1.gcp.elastic.cloud/app/discover|Discover Home>

message.text:
:rotating_light: Auto-remediation Approved
Incident `inc-live-001` on `payments-api` (HIGH).
Reason: Fabrication trap not rejected; confidence penalized
Immediate next steps:
1. Restart the payments‑API pods to clear any stuck requests and restore baseline latency.
2. Immediately throttle inbound traffic (e.g., via rate‑limiting or circuit‑breaker) to reduce the load on the database.
3. Investigate and adjust the database connection pool settings (increase max connections or rebalance pool usage) and, if needed, add read replicas or scale the DB tier.
Links: <https://my-elasticsearch-project-d00169.kb.us-central1.gcp.elastic.cloud/app/discover#/?_a=(query:(language:kuery,query:'service.name%3A%22payments-api%22%20OR%20service%3A%22payments-api%22%20OR%20incident_id%3A%22inc-live-001%22'))|Discover (Service Logs)> | <https://my-elasticsearch-project-d00169.kb.us-central1.gcp.elastic.cloud/app/discover#/?_a=(query:(language:kuery,query:'incident_id%3A%22inc-live-001%22'))|Discover (Workflow Events)> | <https://my-elasticsearch-project-d00169.kb.us-central1.gcp.elastic.cloud/app/management/data/index_management/indices|Stack Management> | <https://my-elasticsearch-project-d00169.kb.us-central1.gcp.elastic.cloud/app/discover|Discover Home>
